entry.title: Batman's Alien Anatomy Data
entry.summary:
Author: BlossomingBitch_15

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 551Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Bruce knows about Kryptonian Biology. Clark had previously allowed him to research whatever he pleased in the Fortress of Solitude after the two of them had become closer.Krypton had more than two common sexes with differing genitalia. There were no public notes on Clark’s sex, and Bruce hadn’t tried hacking the Fortress’ AI out of respect (Clark didn’t have to welcome him into his most private sanctum after all– also, Bruce doubted he could bypass the advanced AI with such a limited time frame).Bruce waits patiently as a silent pillar of support for Clark to regain his confidence. He knows the man is uncomfortable acknowledging his Alien traits, enjoying being seen as more superhuman.Clark pokes at his pie some more, playing with his food as a stalling tactic.“I’ve reached the third stage of Kryptonian maturity. I didn’t even realize I passed the second stage since it seemed like normal teenager’s puberty– I thought I was just a late bloomer before the Fortress was around to reveal my sex.” Clark explains.Bruce processes this, thinking of the previous information he had gathered from the Fortress Of Solitude.The Third Stage of Kryptonian Maturity?“You’re… fertile?”

entry.title: As Though the Sun Will Never Set
entry.summary:
Author: Scarlet609

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 50,930Chapters: 5/65Kudos: 123

Summary: Bruce Wayne has done something to get him sent to live with the Kents, he thought it would be mundane and unfulfilling, but he soon finds himself caught between something dangerous and wonderful. There are factions moving in to claim his prize, his newly found trump card and he's not ready to let it go.Enter Clark, the soft-spoken Kansas farm boy, just a little too wholesome, a little too comfortable with cows and crickets and just a little too strong for his own good.As Bruce enters the plotters and begins weaving his web of seduction and treachery, mundanity seems further and further away, slipping through Clark's fingers.ORThe one in which they are both trapped and enslaved by Clark's growing sexual desire and his alien physiology. entry.title: Operation: Sleep Well, Destroy Better
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,484Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 175

Summary: Clark Kent's marriage to Bruce Wayne threw him straight into the chaos of the Batfam—a den of chronic insomnia and neglected self-care. Determined to enforce at least a bare minimum of healthy routine, Clark declared war on sleepless nights and diets of pure black coffee.Some accepted the changes reluctantly. But Tim Drake? Tim was a whole other challenge.After countless failed attempts to convince him to take better care of himself, Clark decided to fight dirty. The offer? 90 days of regulated sleep and less coffee in exchange for a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity—to humiliate Lex Luthor.Now, the looming question: Will Tim hold up his end of the deal, or will his work obsession (and caffeine addiction) sabotage his own revenge?

entry.title: If you like your coffee hot (let me be your coffee pot)
entry.summary:
Author: emme

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,978Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 244

Summary: Batman didn’t sleep; he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks. He didn’t acknowledge his injuries, his weaknesses, or his limitations. Batman was the night, and the night is relentless, unforgiving, unstoppable.Bruce, on the other hand… he didn’t sleep, he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks either, but he desperately needed to. Clark couldn’t do much about that. He couldn’t very well force the man to take a nap (even if sometimes he wished he could just push him down on a flat surface, effectively close his eyes, and order him to sleep). What he could do, however, was ensure Bruce kept an adequate energy level, the kind of energy level that allows a human being to stand upright, walk, talk, and generally survive life with minimal discomfort.He… fed him. Clark fed him whenever he could.The situation was not spiraling out of control. He could very well handle things, and “acts of service” was not Superman’s love language. It was not.Or:Five times Clark brought food to Bruce and one time he didn’t have to, but he did it anyway.

entry.title: We Could Be Heroes - A SuperBat Love Story
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 68,081Chapters: 26/?Kudos: 110

Summary: Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent both maintain a strong sense of justice and fight for peace in their respective cities. However, both are struggling to maintain order alone, and are weighed down by a lost sense of identity and the loneliness that stems from the isolation of living a double life. After a chance encounter, the pair agree to form a Justice League to address the growing threat to Earth's security. As they learn to work together, new feelings blossom, and the heroes soon find themselves leaning on each other for support and comfort.Slow-burn romance. Bat-family drama. Justice League shenanigans. Bruce being a rich kid with issues. Superman being an innocent lad.Heavily inspired by Batman/Superman The Animated Series, Justice League, & Justice League Unlimited. Also takes inspiration from The Batman (2022), My Adventures With Superman (2023), and Batman: Caped Crusader (2024), and Smallville (2001).

entry.title: Eight Drinks too Many
entry.summary:
Author: Eevee_the_cat

Summary: Bruce tried to used alcohol to calm his nerves to finally ask Clark out. He ended up getting drunk and due to Gotham being Gotham has to be rescued by who else but Batman (aka, Clark Kent). This leads to Clark having to take care of Bruce for the rest of the nightThe next day Dick Grayson is mad he didn’t get a chance to see Uncle Clark and takes his anger out on Bruce.
